column2: Derrota de Calixto Garcia por la columna del Gral Bosch
column4: Spanish General Bosch defeats  the troops of Cuban General Calixto Gracia.
column9: Nettie Lee Benson Latin American Collection, University of Texas Libraries, The University of Texas at Austin
column10: In the public domain. When used please cite as: Chocolates E. Juncosa Trade Cards (Ms. #315), Nettie Lee Benson Latin American Collection, University of Texas Libraries, The University of Texas at Austin.
column36: Calixto Garcia at the end of 1898 was a one of the most important figures in the Cuban American War. He established an area of operations that included Bayamo, Manzanillo, Las Tunas, Palma Soriano, Holguín, and Niquero, giving the Spanish army several defeats.

column2: Huida de Quintin Banderas en el Camagüey
column4: The card depicts Quintín Banderas's escape from Camagüey with the rebel army in blue uniforms running over a hill and the Spanish troops pursuing them horseback.
column9: Nettie Lee Benson Latin American Collection, University of Texas Libraries, The University of Texas at Austin
column10: In the public domain. When used please cite as: Chocolates E. Juncosa Trade Cards (Ms. #315), Nettie Lee Benson Latin American Collection, University of Texas Libraries, The University of Texas at Austin.

column24: Pon las fechas que dice representar y las que serían correctas: 1898|1895-96
column36: The dates shown in the card (1898) do not correspond to the historical event which ocurred in 1895. The battle is depicted as ocurring in X but in reality it took place in Y.

column2: Combate de Canagua donde fue herido el cabecilla Vega
column4: Cuban fighters commanded by Officer Vega fight against the Spanish army in Cunagua. Officer Vega is injured in the combat
column9: Nettie Lee Benson Latin American Collection, University of Texas Libraries, The University of Texas at Austin
column10: In the public domain. When used please cite as: Chocolates E. Juncosa Trade Cards (Ms. #315), Nettie Lee Benson Latin American Collection, University of Texas Libraries, The University of Texas at Austin.
column36: En los cromos se refieren a "Canagua" pero el nombre del lugar es Cunagua. In region of the Las Villas, Cuba. There is  no place called "Canagua" in Cuba.

column2: Los insurrectos son desalojados de las Lomas de Rubí
column4: On March 20, 1896, two Spanish columns, under the command of Colonels Villa and Suárez Inclán, attacked the General Headquarters of the Cuban Liberation Army located on the hills of Rubi, in Pinar del Río Province
column9: Nettie Lee Benson Latin American Collection, University of Texas Libraries, The University of Texas at Austin
column10: In the public domain. When used please cite as: Chocolates E. Juncosa Trade Cards (Ms. #315), Nettie Lee Benson Latin American Collection, University of Texas Libraries, The University of Texas at Austin.
column23: Sierra de los Órganos, Guaniguanico mountain range, Pinar del Rio
column36: A second combat takes place on November 10, 1896, forces of the Liberation Army, under the direct command of General Antonio Maceo, fought at these hills against Spanish forces  led by General González Muñoz.

column2: El Gral Velazco derrota al cabecilla Lacret en Las Villas
column4: The General Velazco defeats Cuban  general Lacret in the Province of Las Villas
column9: Nettie Lee Benson Latin American Collection, University of Texas Libraries, The University of Texas at Austin
column10: In the public domain. When used please cite as: Chocolates E. Juncosa Trade Cards (Ms. #315), Nettie Lee Benson Latin American Collection, University of Texas Libraries, The University of Texas at Austin.
column36: The Spanish General Hernadez Velazco came to be respected by the Cuban insurgent forces given his thoroughness as an officer and because he spared the life of General Rius Rivera, disobeying the orders of General Valeriano Weyler. Lacret  was a Lieutenant under the command of General Antonio Maceo and eventually  become General in the Mambí Army. He commanded the Matanzas area at the end of the War of Independence.

column2: El Gral Arolas y su estado mayor en La Trocha de Mariel
column4:
Spanish General Juan Arolas
Esplugues in his headquarters. He was the military governor of the province of
Habana and military head of the Mariel's Trocha
column9: Nettie Lee Benson Latin American Collection, University of Texas Libraries, The University of Texas at Austin
column10: In the public domain. When used please cite as: Chocolates E. Juncosa Trade Cards (Ms. #315), Nettie Lee Benson Latin American Collection, University of Texas Libraries, The University of Texas at Austin.
column36: The trochas were military fortifications and trails along the island created by the Spanish army to prevent the movement of the rebel troops from one side of the island to another.

column2: Muertes de Maceo y Gomez por la columna del bizarro Coronel Cirujeda
column4:
The card depicts the deaths of  Cuban Generals Antonio Maceo Grajales and Maximo Gomez at the hands of Spanish colonel Cirujeda. Cirujeda was in charge of the
security in the military zone of Marianao (Havana Province).
column9: Nettie Lee Benson Latin American Collection, University of Texas Libraries, The University of Texas at Austin
column10: In the public domain. When used please cite as: Chocolates E. Juncosa Trade Cards (Ms. #315), Nettie Lee Benson Latin American Collection, University of Texas Libraries, The University of Texas at Austin.
column36: This is historically innacurate. Antonio Maceo and Maximo Gomez died in different dates and places. Maceo was killed on December 7,1896 and that Maximo Gomez died on June 17, 1905.
